title: Issue with KL loss
body:
So far, I have mainly used the (default) L2 loss as my regularization loss. I wanted to replace this with the KL loss function. However, I am getting the following error:

> TypeError: An op outside of the function building code is being passed a "Graph" tensor. It is possible to have Graph tensors
leak out of the function building context by including a tf.init_scope in your function building code. For example, the following function will fail:
  @tf.function
  def has_init_scope():
    my_constant = tf.constant(1.)
    with tf.init_scope():
      added = my_constant * 2
The graph tensor has name: loss_1/Conv3D:0

I am assuming that I am just doing something wrong in my code, but I don't understand what it would be and the error is very nondescript so any help would be appreciated. 

**What have I tried**
To test the problem, I have tried to see if I can get the loss function to work on a toy registration problem with just one scan.
Here is the basic `vxm` code:
```
losses = [vxm.losses.NCC().loss]
weights = [1.]
losses += [KL(prior_lambda=25, flow_vol_shape=vol_shape).loss]
weights += [1.]

model = vxm.networks.VxmDense(shpe, nb_features, int_steps=7, int_downsize=1, use_probs=True)
model.compile(optimizer=tf.keras.optimizers.Adam(lr=lr), loss=losses, loss_weights=weights)
```

The loss calculation works through if I do the following: 
```
input, output = next(dataloader)
pred = model.predict(input)

y_true = tf.convert_to_tensor(output[1])
y_pred = tf.convert_to_tensor(pred[1])
print(KL(prior_lambda=prior_lambda, flow_vol_shape=flow_vol_shape).loss(y_true, y_pred))
```
which returns a normal output, e.g. `tf.Tensor(15.010109, shape=(), dtype=float32)`;
but then in the actual training with `model.fit()`, I run into the aforementioned error. 

**Details of experiments**
I am currently using the `dev` branch, as in the `master` branch I could not get the `use_probs` argument to work, and also [some other features](https://github.com/voxelmorph/voxelmorph/discussions/306). From a quick scan it seems that the KL loss has not been changed between the branches.
